content.heading: C++ Math Functions
paragraphs: The <cmath> library has many functions that allow you to perform mathematical tasks on numbers.
This library includes functions for trigonometric calculations, logarithmic and exponential functions, and other common mathematical operations.
A list of all math functions can be found in the table below:
Learn more about math in our C++ Math Tutorial.
By utilizing these functions, developers can easily perform complex calculations and improve code efficiency.

content.heading: Common Functions in the cmath Library
paragraphs: 1. sqrt: Computes the square root of a number.
2. pow: Raises a number to the power of another number.
3. sin: Calculates the sine of an angle (in radians).
4. cos: Calculates the cosine of an angle (in radians).
5. log: Computes the natural logarithm of a number.
